How to Install pioneers-metaserver on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • pioneers-metaserver

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install pioneers-metaserver on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing pioneers-metaserver on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall pioneers-metaserver in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install pioneers-metaserver, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install pioneers-metaserver Using apt

To install pioneers-metaserver in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install pioneers-metaserver using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install pioneers-metaserver

The installation of pioneers-metaserver might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install pioneers-metaserver Using apt-get

To install pioneers-metaserver using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install pioneers-metaserver.

sudo apt-get -y install pioneers-metaserver

Install pioneers-metaserver Using Synaptic

To install pioneers-metaserver using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install pioneers-metaserver on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for pioneers-metaserver. This will display the pioneers-metaserver package in the package window, now to install pioneers-metaserver, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the pioneers-metaserver package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of pioneers-metaserver.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install pioneers-metaserver Using aptitude

To install pioneers-metaserver on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of pioneers-metaserver.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install pioneers-metaserver using the command aptitude install pioneers-metaserver.

sudo aptitude -y install pioneers-metaserver

How to Upgrade pioneers-metaserver on debian

If you want to upgrade the pioneers-metaserver package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade pioneers-metaserver using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade pioneers-metaserver to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade pioneers-metaserver.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade pioneers-metaserver sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade pioneers-metaserver

Upgrade pioneers-metaserver using Aptitude

To upgrade pioneers-metaserver using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade pioneers-metaserver.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade pioneers-metaserver

Upgrade pioneers-metaserver using Synaptic

To upgrade pioneers-metaserver using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for pioneers-metaserver, now right-click pioneers-metaserver, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade pioneers-metaserver just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall pioneers-metaserver on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall pioneers-metaserver from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just pioneers-metaserver, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove pioneers-metaserver

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of pioneers-metaserver

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of pioneers-metaserver you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge pioneers-metaserver

Remove pioneers-metaserver using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall pioneers-metaserver using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for pioneers-metaserver, right-click the pioneers-metaserver package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall pioneers-metaserver click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install pioneers-metaserver on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade pioneers-metaserver using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of pioneers-metaserver then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
